title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly and make you feel comfortable. Made conversation with you and did not make you uncomfortable. I enjoyed my conversations with everyone. It was very simple and centered around me.
Interview Questions: What are you looking for in a position?

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN
Interview Descriptions: Very comfortable and informal. Lab supervisors and directors explain everything well during the interview. The onboarding process is a little timely but ensures that you learn everything you need to.
Interview Questions: What is your experience ? How long have you been doing this?

title: Patient Access Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Elizabethtown, KY) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward, I had a short chat with the recruiter who thought I was overqualified, but I pressed that I was interested in the position. I had an interview with the Practice Manager who asked some common questions with a few more interesting questions. I was given an opportunity to ask my own questions. overall, it was a good process.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN
Interview Descriptions: Standard but then you wait a long time to hear. I didn't hear back for about 6 weeks and it was only because a ferenxe of mine let me know they called them. Hopefully it's quicker now.
Interview Questions: Standard questions that are asked

title: Registered Nurse - Office Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Louisville, KY) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by the actual manager, not a recruiter.  Great explanation of the job.  Made me feel at ease.  Up front about responsibilities and challenges of the job.  Didn't have to come back in and interview with lots of different people - met everyone in one day.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult conversation you had with a provider

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN
Interview Descriptions: Several rounds of interviews including a peer interview and four hour shadow with a staff nurse on the floor in the emergency department. This is after a screening from the nursing recruiter in Human Resources.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had a conflict with a coworker or patient

title: Environmental Services Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN
Interview Descriptions: The process was quick and easy. They explained the position straight forward. They explained all the benefits exactly how they were. Would recommend if you are wanting a health care position.
Interview Questions: Will you be comfortable greeting patients and working with and around them to fit their needs?

title: PT/OT Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with rehab manager and office staff, phone interview and in person interview. Everyone was  very friendly and professional. It was a great experience. Once I completed the interview, the rehab manager took me on a tour of the facility
Interview Questions: What makes you a good fit for this role?

title: Pharmacy Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN
Interview Descriptions: 30 minutes interview, not intimidating but was successful Interviewers were excited to get to know me and learn about my previous job training. My capabilities for the job were lined out. They went over what a typical day would look like to ensure I would be interested in the position still
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in the next 10 years?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Nicholasville, KY) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed for less than 20 minutes and made to feel like I was wasting their time. I have over 10 years of experience in the medical field. I was left waiting in the waiting room of the facility past my interview time. I wasn't given a tour of the facility at all, which seemed weird to me as a potential employee. All in all it was not a good experience for me.
Interview Questions: Why I wasn't certified as a medical assistant yet.

title: Communications Spec Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Elizabethtown, KY) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Simple Questions for tact and professional tones on the phone. Problem solving, how to manage work load. Your demeanor with others who might be difficult to work with. Essentially it is focused on making sure you can handle being the person on the phone that people might chose to take their frustrations out on.
Interview Questions: How would you handle someone berating you on the phone

title: Provider Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN
Interview Descriptions: Two phone interviews with this company, not ending in a job offer. However, at the end of each interview I was informed the job has changed. First to a completely different specialty, then to a different town.
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your current position?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Louisville, KY) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was as easy as it gets. I first interviewed with HR and then with the persn who would be my boss. I mean who wouldn't hire me? I'm sexy and i know it and you know i am just doing this because you made me to view your content
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself and your history

title: Tech Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN
Interview Descriptions: Two weeks after filling out an application, I had a  screening with a recruiter first and then had a follow up in person interview with some of the hiring managers.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time where you dealt with a difficult customer.

title: Room Service Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Corbin, KY)
Interview Descriptions: They asked a bunch of questions and once complete they gave me a tour of kitchen and etc to familiarize me with it. They then asked whether I accepted or declined their offer of $12 an hour.
Interview Questions: What was the one thing they asked you?

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN
Interview Descriptions: Simple and easy. Interviewers were polite and talked to you with respect. I really enjoyed the interview. Highly recommend the company. It was a great experience to say the least
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why you want to work here

title: Registered Nurse, Critical Care Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Louisville, KY)
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty short and general.  Just asked about my experience and the person interviewing me was an a sub-manager.  It was pretty easy.  I didn't feel stressed and the interview was with just one person.  No peer interview was done.
Interview Questions:
What is your experience?
What are you looking for?

title: Registered Nurse Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Louisville, KY) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very detailed questions related to their current situations and issues. This position was new and I’m unsure if leadership was convinced an outside leader would be accepted. Met briefly with Director and then had a lengthy interview with Asst Nurse Managers and other Nurse Managers all at once. There was 8 people who were present and asked questions.
Interview Questions: How would I unify the departments.

title: PCT/CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Lexington-Fayette, KY) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: easy. interview was straight forward and friendly. they asked why i wanted to be a PCT and what my goals were for the future. was offered a job after the interview and accepted it
Interview Questions: why do you wanna work here

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN
Interview Descriptions: Was asked general questions. Name a time when you went above and beyond, etc.  Appreciated the manager because she was very professional. It did feel like it took me a long time to get an actual hour.
Interview Questions: Name a time a coworker or manager upset you and how you handled it

title: Nurse Aide Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN
Interview Descriptions: I went to a scheduled job fair and the nurse recruiter called me back a few days later. Then I went into the facility to interview with the nurse manager.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN
Interview Descriptions: Spoke with recruiter about work experience and how it applied to the job I had applied to and then interviewed with the manager of department. I then was taken around to see the department and speak with staff.
Interview Questions: How many years of experience do you have?

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back, it was one on one. They talked all about nursing school since I am currently attended nursing school. Lots of behavior type questions but I had a lot of examples from nursing clinicals.
Interview Questions:
tell me why you want to be a patient care tech?
what floor specialty are you interested in?

title: Safety Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Louisville, KY) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. They wanted very specific experience, which I had. They called me back and wanted me to interview the next day at 2pm or at 3pm. When I said I couldn't do that due to prior obligations the woman on the phone said "Oh, actually that's all we have available, sorry." and hung up. Even if they called me back I would not be scheduling an interview. It would be one thing, but I met the posting completely, considering I held this position at another facility for a few years. I was expecting at least some professionalism, but I guess it's good I found out before wasting my time in an interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Richmond, KY) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Brief, straight to the point, not many scenario questions. I wasn’t told right away if I had the job or not I had to wait until the next day. Seems more like they were interested in my history and What I was comfortable doing versus my skills
Interview Questions: How do you handle smells?

title: SLP Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Louisville, KY)
Interview Descriptions: It was lengthy. It took approximately 2 months from application which was on line. Waited about a month and I received an email. Then I had an  interview with the director and then a collaborative interview with others in the department before I was hired.
Interview Questions: What are your areas of expertise?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Orlando, FL) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very detailed. Could have asked less questions or questions that were not so specific. Not had to answer i just had to think.Not too intimidating. The staff was really nice. I left the interview feeling confident I got the job. Would not complain.
Interview Questions: Why choose us.

title: RN, Bsn Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Louisville, KY) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening from nurse recruiter.Talked about work history and additional certifications.was offered an interview until she found out I ha been on medical leave from a previous job . Te recruiter said she would need to talk to HR to see if she could schedule an interview. I never received a callback.
Interview Questions: past work history.

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN
Interview Descriptions: had 2 interviews lots of questions  loved interviewing sherry and loved the office i worked in i was the youngest in the office . i miss all of my co workers i wish i could go back but i did not get enough money
Interview Questions: they asked me my weaknesses

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Louisville, KY) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: It's not grueling. It's chill and calm environment. Shows you around the work area. Asks if you have EKG ecg skills and what other skills you possess such as computer blood pressure etc
Interview Questions: What makes you a good fit

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Scottsburg, IN)
Interview Descriptions: Staff was friendly. The interview was with two people and it was very relaxed.  The bulk of the interview was them telling me about their unit and about my responsibilities.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Front Office Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN
Interview Descriptions: It was your standard interview.  I walked in the office early and the manager was ready for the interview.  I answered questions and ask my own questions.  It was a very quick process.
Interview Questions: How would you handle unhappy patients?

title: Anonymous Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Louisville, KY)
Interview Descriptions: The leader was very nice. She was very welcoming as she showed me around. The interview process lasted about an hour. After that she asked me to shadow and we'll they didn't seem like they wanted another person. They were very standoffish. I sat in their break room for about 10 minutes with about 8 of them and not one of them said a word to me.
Interview Questions: What is your weakness

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Louisville, KY) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was interview by 2 nurses, followed by the actual CNAs who currently work there, who were very friendly  and where willing to help adjust in the first couple of days and when ever I needed help.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Baptist?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Louisville, KY) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly managers and discussion about position flexibility was welcomed and clear. Request approved to job shadow to get to know the unit and employees. Met with manager of specific unit and unit coordinator and was offered job after job shadow. Started job 3 weeks after interview.
Interview Questions: What made me want to be a nurse, and why Cardiovascular?

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Louisville, KY) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Easy overall, you meet with your designated floor supervisor or the charge nurse. You go over hours, expectations etc. My interview was pretty relaxed, no complaints. I wasn't really nervous during the interview, if you have the credentials you have nothing to worry about.
Interview Questions: What can you contribute to the job?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: There multiple 1:1 meetings with the hiring manager as well as meetings with other managers.  All of the interview questions were appropriate, and the Baptist team was cordial.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Louisville, KY) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was very straightforward, laid back and easy. It was a manager and an asst. manager. They both asked questions on my background and had me sign some paperwork approving them to do a background, credit and reference check.
Interview Questions: What would a past supervisor say is your strength and weakness?

title: Certified Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Louisville, KY) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: There are supposed to be two interviews - an initial interview (sometimes done over the phone, or in person) and a peer interview with a manager and one or two members of staff. We have always been too short staffed to do two separate interviews, so we had to do both in one visit.
Interview Questions: How would you characterize your relationships with past or current coworkers? What motivates you? What does customer service mean to you? Three strengths/weaknesses. How do you handle criticism from a peer or a supervisor? What type of work schedule do you prefer? What are your career goals? How do you handle working with personalities that are different from yours?

title: Admissions Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied and the next day I got a phone call for an interview. The interview was a couple days after the call and two weeks after my interview I was offered the job. The interview was pretty easy I interviewed with two supervisors, we just talked about my past experience and the differences in the job from my past experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your past experience

title: Front Desk Clerk/Medical Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Louisville, KY) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview with managers at different locations. Easy interview that felt like a meet and greet. Very friendly environment. They told me a little bit about every location and the shifts I might have to work. They have to choose what location they want me to go.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with conflict with a coworker?

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Louisville, KY) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview, Team Interview, Interview with Management Team - at each stage of the interview process was put at ease.  At Baptist they want to not only want and like the job but also be a good fit for the culture.  Culture is one of Team work.
Interview Questions: Standard Interview questions about past work experience and how I can help Baptist.

title: Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (New Albany, IN) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: You are interviewed questions, wait weeks before anyone calls you back, then if hired and you take the job, they say they told you things in the interview that are never mentioned
Interview Questions: hr questions

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Lexington-Fayette, KY) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Had a interview with about 6 of the staff in the department that lasted one hour, then interviewed with a group of 5 Directors that also lasted one hour.  Lastly interviewed with Senior leadership group that included several VPs representing multiple disciplines and departments, including nursing and the VP of HR.  That interview lasted about 45 minutes.  All of these were on the same day.  I answered some of the same questions with each group, but most of the questions were behavioral based interview questions.
Interview Questions: What strengths will you bring to this position?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Louisville, KY) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview with multiple people at same time, as well as followed a staff nurse for part of the shift to see how the unit flow worked compared to my other job
Interview Questions: How do you handle inter-professional collaboration.

title: Nutrition Dietary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Louisville, KY) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Email response to application the employer than schedule an interview schedule during the interview employer than proceeds to ask all basic questions to find out your personality, work experience and reliability after 1 on 1 interview I had the chance to work on the floor under another employee doing what i applied for, to see if I had a feel for position.
Interview Questions: Why did I seek Baptist health for employment,  what is the most difficult situation you ever been in on a previous job how did you go out your way for a customer in the past do you get along with others well,  what would you do if you were to get a complaint from a customer?

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (New Albany, IN) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, and then after two weeks of no calls, I called them myself. I got an interview with the department head, and the nurse coordinator. I had to wear scrubs to my interview. They asked me to sit with someone in the job tite I was applying for, and then after about an hour, they did a peer review with me. I got a response about wether or not I got the job after about a week, and then they set up my orientation.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose Floyd Memorial?

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Crestwood, KY) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had two on phone interviews, but I also had a meeting at a neutral location. I feel they did that for me  so that I would not feel as nervous and I felt that it really helped. I do not think that they do this for normal employment though. I think that only happened because of it being an internship.
Interview Questions: Just got to know me.

title: Phlebotomist At the Clinic Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Madisonville, KY) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview was somewhat informal. I continued to check with the phlebotomy manager on a regular basis. I went in one day for my daughters dr. appt. and stopped by her office and she conducted the interview there with my daughter in the room with us. It was very laid back and comfortable. She then proceeded to tell me that she liked me and what I had to say and told me that should would highly consider hiring me. I later received a phone call asking me to come in and do my drug screen and physical for the position. However after a couple of weeks of being there I was informed the position was no longer available which was an 8 to 5 position Monday- Friday. Later I was offered one of 2 positions at the hospital both 2nd shift.
Interview Questions: How well do I work with other females?

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Louisville, KY) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Have manager interview, then peer interview if they like you, you do a week of orientation then six shifts training on the floor. Other than that i dont have anything else to add. i keep getting flagged for a work minimum
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Patient Service Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (New Albany, IN) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: First interview was a phone interview from the HR recruiter. The in person interview was a panel of 3... The 1st shift supervisor, 2nd/3rd shift supervisor, and the Lab Director. Lasted about an hour had a written competency test. My interview was at 7:30pm...
Interview Questions: If I minded working alone?

title: RN Clinical Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN
Interview Descriptions: It was good....Very open communication with the interviewer and then open lines before hired, the panel interview is a little rough versus a one on one interview situation.....offered postion and salary was negostiated with HR
Interview Questions: what trends do you see in the healthcare market that are related to this positon

title: Catering Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Louisville, KY) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions:
A brief interview 
A tour questions that my interviewer walked me through then left me when someone who obviously wasn't notified training duties
Was trained with two different people 
Told repeatedly I couldn't learn it all in one week and it's a tough job
They are clearly stressed and pressed for time which results in quick hires and fires and improper training
Interview Questions: How do you deal with irate patients

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Louisville, KY) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: First got phone call, then went in for interview with Manager; then went to HR to discuss benefits.  Had to take a typing test and able to type 50 words per minute.  Took a personality test.  Process took about 6 weeks
Interview Questions: What are your 5 year goals?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Louisville, KY) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: When you apply on the website, HR picks a job for you and only puts you through to one interview so that multiple managers don't fight over you...so make sure you only apply to jobs you're actually interested in. I then received a call from the unit manager and scheduled an interview with her. The interview lasted about 20 minutes then she gave me a tour of the unit and I was able to meet some of my future co-workers.
Interview Questions:
What was a time you had a disagreement with a co-worker and how did you handle it?
Describe a time you had a patient or patient's family member who was unhappy with their care and how did you resolve it?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Corbin, KY)
Interview Descriptions: 1 interview; people seemed rushed and scrambled; not as welcoming as one would have hoped
Interview Questions: tell me one bad thing about you

title: Physical Therapist Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (San Antonio, TX) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had one, in person, interview. I asked if there would be a second interview. I was told that HR interviews over the phone first. I week later I called to find out the status of my application. I was told "I'll tell HR to call you. They were supposed to all ready."
Interview Questions: What would you do if a patient you had been working with started refusing to work with you.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN
Interview Descriptions: Was called for phone interview then scheduled for in person interview with Staffing coordinator for the unit and the Unit manager.
Interview Questions: None

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Lexington-Fayette, KY) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Phone then in person interview - was one on one, then a few more persons were introduced. I was given a tour and signed paperwork to submit my background information.
Interview Questions: Favorite Color

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Corydon, IN) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Sat in a small office surrounded by several members of management and asked a variety of questions regarding my professional background.  They asked several questions about why I was interested in the position.  There were several standard interview questions about my ambitions and related interests.  The closeness of the office the interview was done in was uncomfortable.  Otherwise, it was a fairly straight forward interview
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Systems Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Doral, FL) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions:
First had a phone interview where two people questioned me on things that I knew or didn't know.  This took about 2 hours.
After that I was invited in for the group interview, and was told I was one of 3 final candidates.
The group interview was more general, and I realized I should have been better prepared to answer open-ended questions like.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you didn't get along with someone you worked with, and what you did to resolve the issue.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Louisville, KY) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interview process was easy because I was an intern and knew what the job entailed and they already liked me.
Interview Questions: Did not have interview questions

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Louisville, KY) in Jul 2009
Interview Descriptions: I was hired as a new grad so my first interview was with the nurse recruiter - then I interviewed with the nurse manager of the unit where I was eventually hired.  There was also a peer interview from one of the unit staff.  There was a urine drug test after the offer - can't remember if there was a background check - might have been.
Interview Questions: There was a list of prepared questions from the nurse manager that may be standard issue - too long ago to remember now, but something like:  Describe your most difficult challenge in a former job and how you handled it, or something of that sort.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Baptist Health System KY & IN (Lexington, KY) in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: I went to a job fair for CBH. I interviewed with 2 different Unit Managers simultaneously. The questions were fair, and they told me I would hear from them after two days. The interview was on a weekday at 3pm.  By 7pm that night they were calling my cellphone offering me positions on each unit.  This was 2010. I understand that their interview process has now changed where you are interviewed by a panel of 3-4 people.
Interview Questions: I found the interview to be routine, I don't recall any difficult or unexpected questions.
